aws:cdk:cloudformation:props.description: This role is assumed by the buildDeprecatedInstances report to generate a report of all tomcat and apache instances using an outdated AMI

content.description:
**This Runbook is the parent document that executes two child documents that update both tomcat and apache AMIs. There are 4 mainte steps to this document:
 1. Create a CloudFormation Stack to build VPC Endpoints that will enable Systems Manager to communicate with the temporary instances in a private subnet.
 2. Execute the Runbook to patch and update the tomcat AMI.
 3. Execute the Runbook to patch and update the apache AMI.
 4. Delete the CloudFormation stack to remove the VPC Endpoints.

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Required) The ARN of the role that allows Automation to perform the actions on your behalf.

vpcEndpointTemplateURL.description: URL for the CloudFormation Template that creates VPC Endpoints to reach the instance in a private subnet

tomcatDocumentName.description: SSM Parameter Store location that contains the name of the Tomcat Automation Document

apacheDocumentName.description: SSM Parameter Store location that contains the name of the Tomcat Automation Document

content.description: Updates AMI with Linux distribution packages and Amazon software. For details,see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/userguide/automation-awsdocs-linux.html

SourceAmiId.description: (Required) The source Amazon Machine Image ID.

IamInstanceProfileName.description: (Required) The instance profile that enables Systems Manager (SSM) to manage the instance.

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Required) The ARN of the role that allows Automation to perform the actions on your behalf.

InstanceType.description: (Optional) Type of instance to launch as the workspace host. Instance types vary by region. Default is t3.micro.

SecurityGroupIds.description: (Optional) A comma separated list of security group IDs with the required Inbound and Outbound connectivity rules.

SubnetId.description: (Optional) Specify the SubnetId if you want to launch EC2 instance in a specific subnet.

commands: yum -q check-update | tr -s " " | while read PNAME UVERSION extra

content.description: Updates AMI with Linux distribution packages and Amazon software. For details,see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/userguide/automation-awsdocs-linux.html

SourceAmiId.description: (Required) The source Amazon Machine Image ID.

IamInstanceProfileName.description: (Required) The instance profile that enables Systems Manager (SSM) to manage the instance.

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Required) The ARN of the role that allows Automation to perform the actions on your behalf.

InstanceType.description: (Optional) Type of instance to launch as the workspace host. Instance types vary by region. Default is t3.micro.

SubnetId.description: (Optional) Specify the SubnetId if you want to launch EC2 instance in a specific subnet.

commands: yum -q check-update | tr -s " " | while read PNAME UVERSION extra

aws:cdk:cloudformation:props.name: scanAmisForPatches
aws:cdk:cloudformation:props.description: Maintenance Window that launches an apache and tomcat instance, scans for patches, and generates a report uploaded to s3
Task that executes parent document to build resources necessary to generate CSV report with missing patches listed.
Generates a report containing all instances not using the latest Tomcat and Apache AMIs located in Parameter Store
executes Lambda function to delete AMIs and Snapshots with the amiType:tomcat or amiType:apache and markedForDeletion:true tags
